intro: Anethum rupestre, commonly known as rock celery, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional medicine.
